TopicTitle: The Snack Tournament: Aerial Racetrack Challenge

Articles.Content:
The Snack Tournament: Aerial Racetrack Challenge.

Three specially designed aerial racetracks to test your high speed, low altitude flying skills.

THE CHALLENGE:

1.- This challenge is full stock with a separated tier for FAR / NEAR users. Challenge must be completed with the provided ship "Needle". The reason behind this rule is to level the playfield for everyone wanting to test the tracks, the only factor counting towards your score is your skills as a pilot.

2.- Mods allowed: FAR / NEAR. Any visual or aesthetic. Any functional on screen data. Info on screen while running the track as navigational aid allowed. Mods not allowed: Parts or reconfigs of stock parts or fuel, no autopilot mods (unless used only as a data HUD). Of course no F12.

3.- You need to pass through all the pylons on the track to consider it a succesfull run. All contestants will enter the leaderboard and receive a certificate of completion. Leaderboard top 3 will receive special certificates. (pending updates for this)

4.- All tracks are set to 00:00 time (upper left corner clock for mission time), and it starts counting as soon as the provided ship starts moving. Your time ends when the provided ship hits 0/ms braking on the runway.

5.- You can revert to launch in order to reset the clock. If the provided ship is destroyed you can snag a new one from the SPH, is called "The Needle". Challenge must be completed with this ship only.

6.- Colliding with pylon is considered a failed run. Yes, it is possible to survive a collision and continue flying, happened a couple times in my tests.

7.- Video of completed challenge required for qualification. Upload your video to Youtube, Vimeo or any other streaming service and provide the link in the comments to qualify. I know not everybody can run a video recording software, but is difficult to assess completion for this challenge only from still images. I can reccomend Bandicam as a reliable, lightweight and free recording software, good enough for the challenge needs: http://www.bandicam.com/

8.- Future challenges will allow custom ships, but not this one. Again this is a "leveling the playfield" rule, everybody gets to fly the same ship under the same conditions.

9.- No quicksaves, tracks must be complete in one continuous run.

10.- Do you got what it takes, hotshot?

CHALLENGE DOWNLOAD LINK FOR ALL CONTESTANTS: (ship included)

CLICK HERE for a .rar file

CLICK HERE for a .zip file

SHIP DOWNLOAD FOR FAR/NEAR CONTESTANTS ONLY: (tweaked by Wanderfound)

CLICK HERE

How to install the custom racetracks:

1.- Download the tracks, you'll receive 3 folders in a compressed file.

2.- Unpack the zip file using winzip or winrar.

3.- Copy or cut the 3 folders and paste them into your KSP saves folder. If you don't know where to find your saves folder just check this handy link from the KSP wiki: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Root_directory

4.- Open KSP and you'll find the 3 tracks in the "continue saved game" menu.

5.- Copying and moving files on your KSP folder can mess up with your previous saves, remember to make a backup of your saves folder before any change. Provided files are clean of virus and checked for consistency with 0.25. I take no responsibility over saved games FUBAR.

Request: I'm designing the ugliest badges ever created for a challenge, if any of you guys want to contribute with a design for a sig badge post it in the thread or message me, you'll be properly credited.

P.S.: I have zero experience with FAR / NEAR, any ship or track designed for those mods would have to be submitted by you guys until I get around and install the mods and understand them (which could be tomorrow or never, to be clear I'm making no compromises here). So far the tracks seems to work with FAR / NEAR.

Hey Wooks! Probably going to do this challenge... wish me luck! (It reminds me of the Three Bridges Cup, a bit )

But:

If the provided ship is destroyed you can snag a new one from the SPH, is called "The Needle".

Are you allowed to use your own craft for this, or do you have to use "The Needle"?

Thanks, and I'm looking forward to blowing up some pylons!

Edited October 22, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace

Are you allowed to use your own craft for this, or do you have to use "The Needle"?

Thanks, and I'm looking forward to blowing up some pylons!

Custom planes to run these tracks will be allowed in the very near future (along with some new tracks and levels of difficulty), for now I want to level the playfield restricting it to the Needle. Don't worry, is a very fast and maneuverable ship. Added to the rules for clarification.

The Three Bridges cup is an awesome challenge but I wanted something faster, more like a racetrack than an obstacle course.

You destroy as many pylons as you can, I'll send you the check later.

Okay: the loops are too small for anything with a real wingspan. I'll whip up a FAR microplane.

Actually, your Needle works surprisingly well as-is in FAR. See https://www.dropbox.com/s/kyl1nouisi8oyc5/The%20Needle%20Mk1%20FAR.craft?dl=0 for a very lightly tweaked version (unlocked steering and disabled brakes on front gear, set control surfaces to appropriate axes, added action groups to toggle engine and intake) that should work fine in FAR/NEAR.

I'd still like to see a track with larger loops that allowed broad-winged aerobatic planes and supersonic speeds, though.

Edited October 23, 2014 by Wooks

Definitely doable, but extremely not easy:

Glad to hear that larger loops are on the way. Better illumination on the loops would help, too; they're very hard to see from distance against the bright sky and sea. Try to make it so that the lights make obvious which bit is the loop and which bit is the support pylon.

So, slowing time down may be cheating, but you understand the need for it if my time would be (estimated) 11 seconds, right?

And forget about infinite fuel. I don't need it.

So, slowing time down may be cheating, but you understand the need for it if my time would be (estimated) 11 seconds, right?

And forget about infinite fuel. I don't need it.

Alright, I added some rules addressing your questions:

1.- This challenge is full stock with a separated tier for FAR / NEAR users. No other mods allowed. Challenge must be completed with the provided ship "Needle". The reason behind this rule is to level the playfield for everyone wanting to test the tracks, the only factor counting towards your score is your skills as a pilot.

Now having said that, I'm intrigued to see what the heck are you cooking, if you can share a video of your take on the challenge it would be great, it will not count towards the leaderboard but I'll make sure to give you a special certificate of completion.

Edited October 23, 2014 by Wooks

Glad to hear that larger loops are on the way. Better illumination on the loops would help, too; they're very hard to see from distance against the bright sky and sea. Try to make it so that the lights make obvious which bit is the loop and which bit is the support pylon.

My original idea was to make this a night time challenge, that's the reason for the lighting of the loops. I'll fiddle around to see what can I do to make them more visible without increasing the count part.

My original idea was to make this a night time challenge, that's the reason for the lighting of the loops. I'll fiddle around to see what can I do to make them more visible without increasing the count part.

Well, if you can tolerate a few more parts, some structural panels or wing pieces surrounding the loops with lights shining on them would help the visibility a lot.
